intro: Mezochloa aubertii, commonly known as the African ricegrass, is a perennial grass native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the Poaceae family. Mezochloa aubertii is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, making it a resilient species in challenging environments.
